comments.body: `cancel` or `timeout` exception should take it as Bulkead complete operation as permission was successfully acquired or should we release permission()?

It seems to me we asked the same question over `CircuitBreakerFuture`, and the answer we came to was to assume that `get()` or `get(long, TimeUnit)` would be called on the returned `Future` at some point. So what you have here should be fine. If it's not, then we should revisit that question for the circuit breaker case as well.

Good point. If nobody invokes `future.get` the sempahore is never released. I would assume this is a bug in the application of the user then. 
Yes cancel and timout exceptions should also release the permission.
